result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew P Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: $1,110.57 to the WI Department of Justice, and $60.00 to Spencer L.

All court costs, fees and surcharges.
**ALL financial obligations/restitution to be paid or failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered that the defendant:  cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence; and he may never possess a fireram.
Monitored by the Mental Health probation unit.  Mental health assessment and treatment.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  No alcohol or drugs.
No alcohol or drugs.  No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of probation and follow through with any recommended treatment.
All applicable fees of supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew P Lawrence

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order Commuting Probation Term signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  mag
DOC request to commute probation term.

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Spencer L.

Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 3 DAYS time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS.

Court stays 120 DAYS CONDITION TIME IN THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Monitored by mental health probation unit.
- Mental health assesment and treatment.
- No violent contact with victim.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Follow all rules of probation and follow through with any recomended treatment.

Court ordered defendant to pay all of the following by the end of probation.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgment:
- Restitution in the amount of $1,110.57 to the WI Department of Justice & $60.00 to Spencer L; 
- All court costs, fees, and surcharges; 
- All applicable fees of supervision.
- No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.  

Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

Filed:
Victim Impact Statement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Restitution Worksheet.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Communication from Victim Witness Liason, with attachments, FILED.
FILED.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-26-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Nathaniel Adamson for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/30/14.
css

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley on behalf of Attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Janet C Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Michael Lonski.

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. $5,000.00 Personal Recognize Bond, previously issued on 03-06-2014, reinstated with all terms and conditions as ordered on that date.  Preliminary Court contacted for Preliminary Hearing Date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-01-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause, suspended proceedings and ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Forensic Exam is scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 9:30 a.m. with Dr. Rawski in the Wisconsin Forensic Unit. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/14/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Spencer L

Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Matthew P Lawrence in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
